result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anne M Savino in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Anne M Savino in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
n 15CF15952 pl to Ct 1. The State recommends 9 mos RCJ, Ct 2 is DRI; in 15CF1883, pl to Cts 1, 2 & 3 - in Ct 1, the State recommends 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES consec to Ct 1 and in Cts 2 & 3; probation. Balance of the counts are DRI.
P-G to all counts listed above
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for fb - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: Guilty as above. PSI ordered

Defendant Anne M Savino in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Anne M Savino in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking that cash bond be modified to signature in all three files. Defense indicates that the matters are resolved. The State objects citing defts prior conviction for BJ and other offenses that the deft has been arrested on and did not obey conditions of bail. 

BTC: Requests for bond modification is denied  Plea hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
for review of bail, filed by Atty Nolan.
Reading waived.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.
NG plea entered.

Defendant Anne M Savino in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Anne M Savino in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Def Anne Savino by Atty Nolan
Atty Mindy Nolan
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Anne M Savino in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Anne M Savino in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: Vacate warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in custody; original warrant on file.
Warrant forwarded to RPD for entry.

Attorney Kathleen Renee Lang in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant does not appear. Defense indicates she got an email from deft indicating she was in Texas for work and couldn't be here. The State asks for BW/BF
